solution_line_template: Debbie used {tape_per_large} * {num_large} = <<{tape_per_large}*{num_large}={tape_large}>>{tape_large} feet of tape for the large boxes.
She used {tape_per_medium} * {num_medium} = <<{tape_per_medium}*{num_medium}={tape_medium}>>{tape_medium} feet of tape for the medium boxes.
She used {tape_per_small} * {num_small} = <<{tape_per_small}*{num_small}={tape_small}>>{tape_small} feet of tape for the small boxes.
She used {tape_per_label} * {total_boxes} = <<{tape_per_label}*{total_boxes}={tape_labels}>>{tape_labels} feet of tape for the address labels.
Thus, she used {tape_large} + {tape_medium} + {tape_small} + {tape_labels} = <<{tape_large}+{tape_medium}+{tape_small}+{tape_labels}={total_tape}>>{total_tape} feet of tape in all.
